creator: franc_ois78@yahoo.com
text:
When I using <style> task to transform xml ant throws FileNotFoundException.
at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.XSLTProcess.process(XSLTProcess.java:497)
at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.XSLTProcess.execute(XSLTProcess.java:267)
...
The problem is with path names, when basedir (of style task) contains subdirectories
It occurs if I don't use the includes attribute or use it with **/*. or **/*.*
but not if **/*.ext (fortunatelly)
It does not occur if basedir of task contains no directory.
An example 
If I have basedir/subdir/foo.xml it reports basedir/foo.xml not found
so subdir dissappears, as I find out from sources.
Hope it helps.


Franc,ois

creator: conor@apache.org
text: Could you please attach a small example to reproduce this.

creator: dtbaines@xactware.com
text:
I have had the same problem on Win200 with ant 1.6.1 and 1.6.2

<xslt basedir="basedir/" destdir="destdir/" style="style.xsl"/>

incorrectly looks for

/basedir/file_in_subfolder    (no subfolder in path)

instead of

/basedir/subfolder/file_in_subfolder

when changed to

<xslt basedir="basedir/" destdir="destdir/" style="style.xsl" includes="**/*.xml" />

It works correctly.

I tried the includes="**/*" and includes="**/*.*" and had the same problem as
stated above.

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text: what happens if you set scanincludeddirectories to false.

fixed with nightly build 2005-03-22.  As a workaround set scanincludedirectories
to false.
